intro: Leptaloe, commonly known as the rock orchid, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the orchid family, Orchidaceae. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, often fragrant flowers that bloom in spring. The plants typically grow in rocky or crevice habitats, preferring well-drained soils and sunny conditions. Leptaloe species are native to regions in southern Africa, particularly in countries like South Africa and Namibia. Their unique floral structures and ecological adaptations make them interesting subjects for botanical study.
